sanskrit_verse:
गुल्मांश्च स्थापयेदाप्तान् कृतसंज्ञान् समन्ततः ।
स्थाने युद्धे च कुशलानभीरूनविकारिणः ॥ ७.१९०॥
transliteration:
gulmāṃśca sthāpayedāptān kṛtasaṃjñān samantataḥ |
sthāne yuddhe ca kuśalānabhīrūnavikāriṇaḥ || 7.190||
sph_interpretive_translation: In every domain—civil and martial—those who are trustworthy, established in awareness, skilled, fearless, and unshaken must be positioned.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from inner integrity and proven competence.
Causation arises through conscious placement aligned with capacity.
Capacity-based responsibility demands selection rooted in steadiness and skill.
Restoration logic requires optimal alignment between role and consciousness.
Consciousness alignment ensures societal harmony through rightful positioning.
executable_legal_axioms: IF individual exhibits trustworthiness AND demonstrated skill THEN assign to position of civil or martial responsibility.
IF fearlessness and emotional stability are verified THEN eligibility for strategic roles is granted.
IF misplacement occurs due to negligence THEN realign based on recalibrated capacity assessment.
ALL placements MUST reflect consciousness-readiness and functional mastery.
RESPONSIBILITY follows naturally when capacity is authentically recognized and affirmed.
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, this verse establishes that judicial officers must be selected exclusively from among those proven in discernment, unshaken by external pressures, and fully capable of maintaining equanimity under adversarial conditions. Misplaced authority results in systemic distortion; hence, continuous verification of inner readiness becomes a constitutional duty.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that right outcomes emerge only when individuals are placed according to their actual capacities. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that improper assignment leads to cascading disharmony. Proportional responsibility lies in ensuring correct alignment rather than assigning blame. The non-punitive reality rule affirms correction through realignment, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Conduct periodic consciousness-validation assessments for all holders of authority.
Implement reintegration processes where roles are reassigned based on evolved capacity.
Establish completion protocols for any failure arising from mismatched assignments.
Facilitate integrity-renewal practices for leaders showing signs of instability or fear.
Enforce transparency in appointment procedures grounded in observable competence and fearlessness.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands declared: Truthful governance emerges only when positions are filled by the rightly conscious. Dharma prevails through alignment, not force. There is no punishment—only restoration. Consciousness alone is the final arbiter.
